messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-RefSampling repo implement?
The ComfyUI-RefSampling repo implements 'Reference CNet' and 'Visual Style Prompting' techniques for image generation.
'Reference CNet' is a technique found in popular image generation applications like Automatic11 that allows image generation to adhere content to a reference image.
'Visual Style Prompting' is a technique that allows image generation to adhere style to a reference image.
How do 'Reference CNet' and 'Visual Style Prompting' work?
Both 'Reference CNet' and 'Visual Style Prompting' techniques utilize attention injection from reference images into the sampled or generated image.
Can you provide an example of text to image generation using ComfyUI-RefSampling?
Sure. With an image prompt 'orange gorilla stripes' and a visual style prompt 'black and orange stripes', ComfyUI-RefSampling can generate an image of an orange gorilla with black and orange stripes.
Can you provide an example of image to image generation using ComfyUI-RefSampling?
Sure. With an input image of an old man and a visual style prompt 'blue dragon, flames', ComfyUI-RefSampling can generate an image of an old man transformed into a blue dragon with flames.
What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-RefSampling repo?
The purpose of the ComfyUI-RefSampling repo is to provide a proof-of-concept for implementing 'Reference CNet' and 'Visual Style Prompting' techniques in image generation.
